title: Tests: Full-stack API integration tests
description:
## Objective
Create full-stack integration tests that exercise the complete API layer with real database operations.

## Scope
- Test all REST API endpoints end-to-end
- Verify database state changes
- Test error handling and edge cases
- Test concurrent operations

## Test Scenarios
1. CRUD operations on beads via API
2. Dependency management (add/remove deps, cycle detection)
3. Bulk operations (close multiple, batch update)
4. Search and filtering endpoints
5. Stats and reporting endpoints
6. Error responses (404, 400, validation errors)
7. Concurrent access handling

## Files to Create
- tests/integration/test_api_fullstack.py
- tests/integration/test_concurrent_access.py
- tests/integration/conftest.py (test fixtures, temp database)

## Requirements
- Use pytest with httpx or requests
- Isolated test database per test run
- Clean setup/teardown

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All API endpoints covered
- [ ] Edge cases tested
- [ ] Concurrent access tested
- [ ] Tests are isolated and repeatable

title: Dashboard: Create FastAPI app skeleton with config

## Files to Create
- dashboard/app.py - Main FastAPI app

## App Requirements
- FastAPI app with title "Multi-Agent Dashboard"
- CORS middleware (localhost only)
- Static file mounting
- Jinja2 template configuration
- Health check endpoint at /health

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `uv run python -m dashboard.app` starts server
- [ ] GET /health returns {"status": "ok"}
- [ ] Templates directory configured
close_reason: Commit a7eb268: FastAPI app skeleton created with /health endpoint. No remote configured for PR.

title: Scripts: Create monitor.py terminal monitor
description:
## Objective
Create terminal-based monitoring script.

## File to Create
- scripts/monitor.py

## Features
- Poll bd list every 10 seconds
- Group beads by status
- Show agent assignments
- Display recent log entries
- Clear screen between updates

## Display Format
============================================================
MULTI-AGENT STATUS - 14:30:00
============================================================

[DEVELOPER]
  mab-abc123: Implement login endpoint (45m)
  mab-def456: Fix validation bug (12m)

[QA]
  mab-ghi789: QA: Login flow (5m)

------------------------------------------------------------
RECENT ACTIVITY
------------------------------------------------------------
  14:29:55 [developer-1] CLAIM: mab-abc123
  14:28:30 [qa-1] CLOSE: mab-xyz999

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Updates automatically
- [ ] Shows all active work
- [ ] Easy to read in terminal
close_reason: Commit b00df49, no remote for PR

title: QA: Dashboard API endpoints
description:
## Objective
Verify all dashboard API endpoints work correctly.

## Test Cases
1. GET /api/beads returns valid JSON
2. GET /api/beads?status=open filters correctly
3. GET /api/beads?label=dev filters correctly
4. GET /api/beads/ready returns only unblocked
5. GET /api/beads/{id} returns correct bead
6. GET /api/beads/{invalid} returns 404
7. GET /api/agents returns agent list
8. POST /api/beads creates new bead
9. SSE /api/logs/stream connects and streams

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] Error responses are consistent
- [ ] Performance acceptable (<500ms)

title: Dashboard: Create dependency graph visualization
description:
## Objective
Add visual dependency graph for beads.

## Library Options
- Mermaid.js (simple, text-based)
- D3.js (complex, interactive)
- Cytoscape.js (graph-focused)

## Recommended: Mermaid.js
- Simpler integration
- Auto-layout
- Supports flowchart syntax

## Implementation
- Generate Mermaid syntax from bd dep data
- Render in separate tab/modal
- Color nodes by status

## Example Output
graph TD
  A[Design] --> B[Implement]
  B --> C[Review]
  C --> D[QA]
  style A fill:#22c55e
  style B fill:#3b82f6

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Graph renders correctly
- [ ] Colors indicate status
- [ ] Clickable nodes
close_reason: Commit f634b6b - Mermaid.js dependency graph visualization with status colors and clickable nodes

title: Config: Create roles.yaml
description:
## Objective
Define role configurations.

## File to Create
- config/roles.yaml

## Content Per Role
roles:
  developer:
    prompt: prompts/DEVELOPER.md
    label_filter: dev
    color: green
    max_instances: 3
  qa:
    prompt: prompts/QA.md
    label_filter: qa
    color: blue
    max_instances: 2
  tech_lead:
    prompt: prompts/TECH_LEAD.md
    label_filter: architecture
    color: yellow
    max_instances: 1
  manager:
    prompt: prompts/MANAGER.md
    label_filter: null  # sees all
    color: purple
    max_instances: 1
  reviewer:
    prompt: prompts/CODE_REVIEWER.md
    label_filter: review
    color: cyan
    max_instances: 2

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All roles defined
- [ ] Colors assigned
- [ ] Filters correct
close_reason: Config file created and committed. All acceptance criteria met: all 5 roles defined, colors assigned, label filters configured.

title: Tests: Multi-agent coordination integration tests
description:
## Objective
Create integration tests that verify multiple agents can work together correctly on the beads system.

## Scope
- Test agent role interactions
- Verify handoffs between agents work correctly
- Test conflict resolution when agents compete for work
- Verify blocking/dependency chains work with multiple agents

## Test Scenarios
1. Developer agent creates work, QA agent picks it up
2. Two agents try to claim same bead (conflict handling)
3. Tech Lead creates dependent tasks, Dev agents work in order
4. Agent gets blocked, another agent unblocks it
5. Full workflow: Epic  Tasks  Implementation  QA  Close

## Files to Create
- tests/integration/test_multi_agent.py
- tests/integration/test_agent_conflicts.py

## Requirements
- Simulate multiple agent sessions
- Use subprocess or threading to simulate concurrency
- Verify bead states after each operation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Role handoffs tested
- [ ] Conflict scenarios covered
- [ ] Dependency chains work correctly
- [ ] No race conditions or data corruption

title: Tests: E2E browser testing with Playwright
description:
## Objective
Create end-to-end browser tests using Playwright to test the dashboard UI.

## Scope
- Browser automation tests for dashboard
- Test user workflows through the UI
- Visual regression testing (optional)

## Test Scenarios
1. Load dashboard and verify initial state
2. Navigate between views (Kanban, dependency graph)
3. Interact with bead cards (click, expand details)
4. Test filtering and search functionality
5. Verify real-time updates when beads change
6. Test responsive layout at different screen sizes

## Files to Create
- tests/e2e/test_dashboard_e2e.py
- tests/e2e/conftest.py (Playwright fixtures)

## Requirements
- Use Playwright for Python
- Tests should be hermetic (setup/teardown test data)
- Run against local dev server

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Playwright installed and configured
- [ ] Core dashboard flows covered
- [ ] Tests pass reliably in CI
- [ ] Screenshots captured on failure

description:
## Objective
Verify documentation is complete and accurate.

## Review Checklist
- [ ] README quick start works
- [ ] USAGE.md commands are correct
- [ ] ARCHITECTURE.md diagrams render
- [ ] All links work
- [ ] No typos or unclear sections
- [ ] Examples are runnable

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All docs reviewed
- [ ] Issues fixed or noted
close_reason: QA review complete - all docs verified accurate and complete

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text:
## QA Documentation Review Complete

### Review Checklist Results

- [x] **README quick start works** - setup.sh exists, commands correct
- [x] **USAGE.md commands are correct** - verified bd flags (--labels, --priority, --type all work)
- [x] **ARCHITECTURE.md diagrams render** - ASCII art renders in all markdown viewers
- [x] **All links work** - PLAN.md, AGENTS.md, prompts/, config/ all exist and correct
- [x] **No typos or unclear sections** - documentation is clear and well-organized
- [x] **Examples are runnable** - tested bd ready, bd stats, uv run pytest

### Verification Performed
- Tested `bd ready -l dev` - works correctly
- Tested `bd create --help` - flags match documentation
- Tested `bd stats` - returns valid output
- Tested `uv run pytest` - 142 tests pass
- Tested dashboard imports - OK
- Tested `python3 scripts/spawn_agent.py --help` - matches documented usage
- Verified config/roles.yaml matches USAGE.md examples exactly
- Verified config/labels.yaml matches USAGE.md examples exactly
- Verified all prompts/ files exist as referenced

### Notes
- macOS users may need `python3` vs `python` but uv commands work correctly
- All external links (GitHub repos) point to valid projects

**Overall: Documentation is accurate, complete, and ready for use.**

title: Dashboard: Implement /api/agents endpoints
description:
## Objective
Create endpoints for agent status monitoring.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/agents.py

## Endpoints
GET /api/agents         - List active agent sessions
GET /api/agents/{role}  - Agents of specific role

## Data Model
{
  "role": "developer",
  "instance": 1,
  "current_bead": "mab-abc123",
  "status": "working",
  "last_activity": "2025-01-24T14:30:00Z"
}

## Implementation
- Parse claude.log for SESSION_START entries
- Match with CLAIM entries to find current bead
- Track last activity timestamp

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Returns list of active agents
- [ ] Shows current bead per agent
- [ ] Updates in near-real-time
close_reason: Commit f62f969 - /api/agents endpoints implemented with 23 tests, no remote for PR

title: Scripts: Create spawn_agent.py
description:
## Objective
Create script to spawn role-based agents.

## File to Create
- scripts/spawn_agent.py

## Features
- Accept role argument (developer, qa, tech_lead, manager, reviewer)
- Accept instance number (default 1)
- Accept repo path (default current dir)
- Load role-specific prompt
- Set environment variables
- Open new terminal with claude session

## Usage
python scripts/spawn_agent.py developer --instance 1 --repo /path/to/repo

## macOS Terminal Integration
osascript -e 'tell app "Terminal" to do script "..."'

## Environment Variables to Set
- AGENT_ROLE
- AGENT_INSTANCE
- AGENT_LOG_FILE

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 5 roles work
- [ ] Multiple instances spawn
- [ ] Prompts load correctly
close_reason: Commit 238b201 - All 5 roles work, multiple instances spawn, prompts load correctly

title: Dashboard: Implement /api/beads endpoints
description:
## Objective
Create REST API endpoints for bead operations.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/beads.py

## Endpoints
GET  /api/beads              - List all beads (with filters)
GET  /api/beads/ready        - Ready beads only (no blockers)
GET  /api/beads/in-progress  - In-progress beads
GET  /api/beads/{id}         - Single bead details
POST /api/beads              - Create new bead

## Query Parameters for GET /api/beads
- status: open|in_progress|closed
- label: filter by label
- priority: filter by priority

## Implementation
- Use subprocess to call `bd list --json`
- Parse JSON output
- Apply filters

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All endpoints return valid JSON
- [ ] Filters work correctly
- [ ] Error handling for bd failures
close_reason: Implemented all /api/beads endpoints (GET list, GET ready, GET in-progress, GET by ID, POST create). Commit 676c408. No remote configured for PR.

title: Dashboard: Create live log viewer panel
description:
## Objective
Create collapsible panel showing live logs.

## Files to Create
- dashboard/templates/partials/log_panel.html

## Features
- Expandable/collapsible panel
- Auto-scroll to bottom
- Syntax highlighting for log types:
  - SESSION_START: green
  - CLAIM: blue
  - CLOSE: purple
  - ERROR: red
  - BLOCKED: orange
- Filter by agent role
- Filter by bead ID

## Implementation
- Connect to /api/logs/stream SSE
- Append new entries to list
- Keep last 100 entries in view

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Live streaming works
- [ ] Color coding applied
- [ ] Filtering works
- [ ] Auto-scroll toggleable

title: QA: Validate all prompts
description:
## Objective
Review all prompts for completeness and accuracy.

## Verification
For each prompt:
1. bd commands are syntactically correct
2. Role boundaries are clear
3. No overlap between roles
4. _COMMON.md is referenced
5. Workflow is unambiguous
6. Acceptance criteria are verifiable

## Cross-Check
- Developer doesn't do QA work
- QA doesn't write production code
- Tech Lead doesn't do prioritization
- Manager doesn't make architecture decisions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All prompts reviewed
- [ ] No conflicting instructions
- [ ] Commands validated
close_reason: Verification PASSED - All prompts reviewed: bd commands valid, role boundaries clear, no overlaps, _COMMON.md referenced, workflows unambiguous. Minor observation: test-writing responsibility unclear (design gap, not conflict).

title: Dashboard: Implement SSE log streaming
description:
## Objective
Create Server-Sent Events endpoint for real-time log streaming.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/logs.py

## Endpoints
GET /api/logs/stream    - SSE endpoint for live logs
GET /api/logs/recent    - Last N log entries

## Implementation
- Use `tail -f` subprocess for log following
- Yield events as SSE format
- Filter by role/bead if requested

## SSE Format
data: {"timestamp": "...", "role": "developer", "event": "CLAIM", "message": "..."}

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SSE connection stays open
- [ ] New log entries stream in real-time
- [ ] Handles log file rotation gracefully
close_reason: Implemented SSE log streaming endpoints. Commit 72c67de. All 46 tests pass.
